config_description: controls how often to reset all host scores, allowing a bad host to possibly recover
developer_understanding_on_working: The dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms configuration controls how often to reset all host scores, allowing a bad host to possibly recover. The code snippet provided shows that the configuration value is read from DatabaseDescriptor and used to schedule tasks that reset the scores of hosts at the specified interval.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms configuration is triggered whenever the applyConfigChanges method is called, which checks if the configured reset interval has changed and updates the scheduler accordingly. Additionally, the configuration can also be triggered when the updateSnitch method is called with a new reset interval value.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms configuration option is that it affects the frequency at which host scores are reset. A shorter interval may result in more frequent score resets, potentially allowing bad hosts to recover faster. On the other hand, a longer interval may delay the recovery process for bad hosts.
